info: This means your car is too hot. Pull over and if temperature stays high, exit vehicle and call for help.
This icon is telling you to check your oil. Not to worry at this moment, but make sure to check your oil soon.
This means you are running on battery. While not a hazard, long battery-only use is not recommended.
Indicates one of 3 things: parking brake is on, problem with the braking system/fluid, or ABS problem. Professional opinion recommended.
Indicates the engine computer has a Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC). If icon is blinking, IMMEDIATE professional diagnosis recommended.
Goes on when vehicle's traction control/anti-skid is in use. Usually means conditions are slippery. Drive slowly!
Indicates that the Anti-lock Brake computer has set a code. Professional diagnosis recommended.
Indicates the TPMS system has found a tire with low air pressure or there may be a sensor malfunction. Check your tire pressure, & if problem consists, professional diagnosis recommended.
Indicates washer fluid is low. Not to worry! Just fill up your fluid tank; Driving without fluid is not recommended.
Indicates that the vehicle's front fog lamps are illuminated. No worry necessary, your car is letting you know they are working in foggy conditions.
If light stays illuminated after starting, there is a fault in airbag system. Professional repair is highly recommended.
Indicates that you need to BUCKLE UP. No further explanation necessary.
